name: Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites Florence NE

reviews.text: I stay in Florence quite a bit for work and normally stayed at Hamptons, but since they built a Holiday Inn Express I moved to there location instead. I have to say it is a great hotel and enjoy the manager reception they have on monday nights, plus I like the location were I can walk to many restaurants unlike the other hotels in the area not many restaurant selections within walking distance. The place has great employees front desk have to say outstanding service when I checkin and they always hand me a little goody snack and I alway enjoy that free upgrade because of my platinum status. I've never had a problem and I highly recommend this place to anyone whom is traveling it is definetly a home away from home for me since I live in hotels 5 days out of the week.
reviews.title: TVA kind of Man

reviews.text: My weekend stay at this hotel was great, from customer service to cleanliness. The hotel seems fairly new alongside a good location (across from Logan's). Hotel's like this are why I am a Platinum member. Spacious rooms and friendly staff are reasons why I plan to stay here in the future.
reviews.title: Great Property

reviews.text: I stay at the Holiday Inn Express when I visit my home town of Florence,AL. I use to stay at the Marriott, but learned that I enjoy Holiday Inn more. The staff is very polite and curtious. The rooms are easily accessible, comfortable, and clean; and the location is prime with easy commute to popular restaurants and shopping areas. I definitely recommend this hotel with confidence that others will enjoy their experience here, as I do.
reviews.title: A nice home away from home.

reviews.text: I cancelled my reservation and checked in across the street. The front desk clerk told me I came in with an attitude because I said I was a Platinum member. She told me Platinum was not 'all that' and that she was also a Platinum member, so it did not mean anything. I wanted to check into one of the clean rooms prior to check in time. there were 6 cars in the lot. She admitted there were several clean rooms available, but it would be too much trouble to re-do the paperwork. When I told her I was Platinum and did not think I should have to wait for a specific room when so many were available, she launched into her "You have an attitude, I'm Platinum too, you ain't all that..." diatribe. I checked into the hotel across the street, less expensive and newer. (Comfort Inn).
reviews.title: Shockingly rude front desk clerk

reviews.text: The good fortune that you choose this hotel and booking it for sixteen days' since two months ago and that on a business trip I came from the Middle East for the first time to America, dear country of freedom and beauty found at this hotel all the services I need and the Officials and staff at the hotel at the top of morality and progress deal and this hotel is in the foreground in this peaceful city.
reviews.title: Beautiful memories

reviews.text: Stayed here for a family wedding. Staff was very friendly and accommodating. Convenient location to many restaurants, shopping and attractions. Clean rooms, great breakfast included.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay

reviews.text: We had several family members staying here and they placed us on the same floor close to each other. Others from the family came to join us at various times of the day and we found the breakfast bar a great place to sit and talk. would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Weekend trip

reviews.text: The hotel was GREAT! I would highly recommend it, we were there for a family reunion and only stayed one night, room was clean, the breakfast was fantastic and the employees was so helpful.
reviews.title: CLEAN and comfortable

reviews.text: That will be our hotel choice when we stay in Florence AL.
reviews.title: Great Hotel and Great Staff

reviews.text: The staff at this hotel was helpful and welcoming. My main criteria for a hotel is cleanliness. We were able to allow our 13 month old grandson to play on the floor. The breakfast has a good variety and taste home cooked. Parking and lighting made us feel safe.
reviews.title: Quality Hotel :)

reviews.text: We have stayed here before and wee very happy, we were traveling from the Dallas Market Center and after 3 days of purchasing inventory we were wiped out and all of our credit cards maxed out; so we were down to cash. We thought we would try something new and saw the wonderful reviews for the comfort inn suites; and apparently they couldn't take the cash without a credit placing a 100 hold. Next time I will just come directly here and save myself time and trouble.
reviews.title: Very helpful; and they take cash unlike the comfort inn suites

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place looks nice upon first glance, but on further inspection it's obvious that cleanliness is lacking. I went to take a shower and found dried, bloody snot on the shower curtain! Not just a little, but quite a lot. Absolutely disgusting. Coffee pot in the room was filthy, too, not that I was planning to use it. I also found long white hairs on the bed blanket (we don't have white hair). Wi-fi was terrible, too. I won't stay at another Holiday Inn Express ever again.
reviews.title: Snot on the Shower Curtain

reviews.text: The hotel appears fairly new and well maintained. The rooms are large, the beds are good, has the standard mini fridge, micro and coffee maker. The internet is fast, the breakfast is standard waffles and muffins. The location is OK, pretty commercial, one restuarant in walking distance, short drive to others. No real home away from home feel, just a little too commercial.
reviews.title: Nice Place

reviews.text: OK for an in and out overnight stay.
reviews.title: Such a delight to see coffee out at 4:30 am

reviews.text: When your clock is off - Eastern time and don't want to wake your mate making coffee in the bathroom- well it was a delight to have coffee there, the TV news on. Recently updated so rooms were perfect.
reviews.title: It was what I would expect for the money...

reviews.text: I had a pleasant stay at this hotel. Upon check-in, I was 3 to 4 hours early for the normal check in period. The hotel had been full the previous night and housekeeping was still in the process of trying to clean rooms for new arrivals. I explained to the front desk clerk, Zach, that I had been working out in the rain all morning and was soaked from head to toe. Instead of giving me the "sir, we don't have any rooms available yet," Zach expedited calls to housekeeping and got me into a room without hesitation. After arriving in my room, I noticed cleanliness, a spacious bathroom, vibrant room colors, flat screen tv, and most importantly hair free bedding! The pool area and fitness center was a plus for those that work away from home, and the hotel had an overall newer modern look that drew me to it also. Highly recommended for Florence. Please give Zach, housekeeping, and rest of staff credit for making your hotel what it is.
reviews.title: Top-rated Hotel

reviews.text: This hotel has to be the nicest in Florence! The outside is very nicely landscaped, kept clean and has small touches like stepping stones from parking lot to the sidewalk! The lobby is very well done. Hotel has a great exercise room, breakfast room with those great cinnamon rolls and a pancake machine! Exercise room had sanitizing wipes for the machines which I love. Rooms were very clean and well appointed. I don't know how old this hotel is, but it looks brand new.
reviews.title: WOW What a Great Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: How refreshing it is when you arrive in a new town and are greeted with a friendly smile. It just makes all the difference. This property was a great experience. Tired and hot, once we checked into our room, we checked out the pool. I had a man look and didn't see any towels so went and asked, was told where they were, but found only one. By the time I had got back down in my swimming trunks, there was a big pile of hot fresh towels straight out of the clothes dryer.
reviews.title: Service with a smile

reviews.text: The gym had new equipment, the dining room had hot coffee all day and night.
reviews.title: Nice friendly and almost cosy

reviews.text: The room was spotless and full of little extras as you would expect (but don't find in all) from most IHG properties. The air con was nice and quiet and the hotel was handy to food and shopping.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel in a great location - From a Road Warrior perspective

aka: Holiday Inn Express Hotel And Suites Florence Ne
description: Our Florence, Alabama hotel's near the Tennessee River. The Holiday Inn Express® Florence Northeast Hotel is located in the northwest corner of Alabama, an area best known for its variety of outdoor activities. As you visit this friendly town, pause to enjoy the surrounding countryside, which includes the beautiful Tennessee River and Pickwick Lake. Business travelers lodging in Florence appreciate our on-site Business Center and 1,008-square-foot meeting room. We are close to many major businesses, including Wise Alloys, TNT Fireworks, TVA (Tennessee Valley Authority), Coca-Cola Bottling Co., Florence Industrial Park and North American Lighting. The University of North Alabama, Eliza Coffee Memorial Hospital and Helen Keller Hospital are located in Florence, Alabama. Our hotel's property is near the Tennessee River, which boasts excellent fishing, swimming and boating. After a busy day on the river, slow down and enjoy a leisurely game of golf at The Shoals, part of the popular Robert Trent Jones Golf Trail. The family can enjoy a visit to the Alabama Music Hall of Fame, as well as the Helen Keller House and WC Handy Birthplace & Museum. You can begin each day with a fantastic meal from our complimentary hot breakfast bar, and while lodging in Florence, our guests can also take advantage of the free high-speed, wireless Internet access we provide in each guest room. Our hotel also features an indoor pool and Fitness Center. Welcome!
